paper_abstract: This paper discusses generalization bounds for complex data learning which serve as a theoretical foundation for complex support vector machine (SVM). Drawn on the generalization bounds, a complex SVM approach based on the Szego kernel of the Hardy space H-2(D) is formulated. It is applied to the frequency-domain identification problem of discrete linear time-invariant system (LTIS). Experiments show that the proposed algorithm is effective in applications.
paper_title: Sparse representation in Szego kernels through reproducing kernel Hilbert space theory with applications
